snippet: A weekly increase in new cases, the first this year, was worrisome because some of them were patients who had not been listed for monitoring, health officials said.
abstract: Number of Ebola cases in West Africa rises for the first time in 2015, worrying health officials.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: A weekly increase in new cases, the first this year, was worrisome because some of them were patients who had not been listed for monitoring, health officials said.

headline.main: Small Rise in New Cases Shows Ebola Hanging On
headline.print_headline: Small Rise in New Cases Shows Ebola Hanging On
